attributes.action: Leave the EU on March 29th regardless of whether a deal is approved or rejected.
attributes.additional_details:
Debate on the second 'meaningful vote' - rejected
Debate on no-deal Brexit - rejected
Government's Brexit deal - rejected
Debate on Article 50 extension - accepted

https://www.parliament.uk/business/news/2019/march/key-brexit-vote-as-meaningful-vote-returns-to-the-commons/
https://www.parliament.uk/business/news/2019/march/house-of-commons-to-vote-on-no-deal-brexit/
https://www.parliament.uk/business/news/2019/march/this-week-in-the-commons-15-march-2019/
attributes.background: The Prime Minister is attempting to delay Brexit with the belief that her deal will pass despite the fact the EU are unwilling to make meaningful changes. Bercow has already concluded that MPs cannot vote on her deal unless it is substantially changed. A no deal Brexit seems to be the viable option.
